alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Jackson; Oglala Lakota (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:37PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN OGLALA LAKOTA... SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON AND NORTHWESTERN BENNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM MDT... At 937 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Potato Creek to Badlands National Park to 3 miles northwest of Lonesome Valley. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kyle North Route Housing, Thunder Valley, Lonesome Valley, Rockyford, and southern Badlands National Park around 940 PM MDT. Kyle, Potato Creek, and Sharps Corner around 945 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Snake Butte and northern Yellow Bear Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
